meanings.definition: A red or orange dye used in biological staining.
meanings.sent1: The safranin dye gave a bright color to the microscope slide.
meanings.sent2: Biologists use safranin to color cells for better visibility under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The safranin dye decided to throw a party in the petri dish, making the cells look festive.
meanings.sent4: The safranin dye painted the cells in a vibrant hue, like an artist on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: The vivid red of safranin made the cells stand out like a beacon in the lab.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound used as a counterstain in histology.
meanings.sent1: The histologist applied safranin as a counterstain to highlight specific structures.
meanings.sent2: Safranin is commonly used in histology labs to enhance the contrast of tissues.
meanings.sent3: The safranin compound played hide-and-seek with the other stains in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The safranin counterstain acted like a spotlight, illuminating the hidden details of the tissue.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the safranin counterstain revealed intricate patterns in the tissue sample.
